title: Is Narcissism a mental illness? - Quora

response.answer_text: It falls under the category of “Abnormal Psychology” and “Personality Disorders”. This group a hundred years ago was called “crazy” or “neurotic/psychotic”. It is part of a group of personalities or thinking, believing, behaving abnormally that causes them or others pain and damage. The origin like the others in this category is due to early childhood trauma and other issues in childhood and is formed to compensate, tolerate and survive. In other words it is unformed or malformed and normal steps of growth are not met or finished. Narcisissts have little or no authenticity. They cannot care much about anyone else so they cannot love, forgive, nor appreciate and all the tender and meaningful heart felt feelings that make life good. They can’t connect. They are too busy playing King or Queen to see what the heck is happening. One might rarely see the narcissist as the first or “identified” patient. More likely it would be their partner or children who end up in therapy as a result of their completely self centred feelings and behaviour. A teenager might be sent to a therapist, and an insightful one under the right circumstance might say, the reason you are depressed sounds like your parents show you very little feelings, I need to see them. Having done so, discovers indeed that one or both parents are narcissistic. That the young person has been terribly neglected and emotionally abused. However it would take a rare narcissist to continue therapy because they “like the way they are” and in fact others are “just jealous”. Another way the narcissist might end up in therapy is from the spouse or partner being miserable and seeking help. In such a case the N might have invested enough time money and resources to desire some change. Or perhaps everyone in their life has left them, or they’ve been fired from every job, or it’s their 5th divorce. However it is a diagnosis that is hard if not impossible to change. Also few therapists would find the work of being with someone so self-centered bearable. It would take a long commitment. It could get very expensive. And uncovering the reason why they are as they are, is very painful, it was after all, painful enough to create this whole false facade. Note that: I have in my long life, witnessed two people (Ns) who successfully went through therapy and came out much better people. They may be slightly “vain” but they have found their hearts and care about others. On the other hand, they were never cruel Ns to begin with.

if you are referring to the personality like Obama, Trump, etc the answer is yes….. however this isn’t narcissism in its actual form, Narcissism in its actual form has one weakness…….there is none….. literally everything revolves around them even to helping you out is really about them and those tears? that is just added benefit. What happens is they weren’t disciplined and given praise at the same time as a child and their “inner child” is looking for praise all the rest of their life to where their victims are feeding that lust for praise that they are missing out as a child. While Obama and Trump are full of themselves they don’t have in my opinion the actual Narcissistic Personality Disorder. The good news is that while we may say people such as that are “narcissistic” we don’t really mean that we just mean they are full of themselves and a good high ego is not a bad thing its only a bad thing when it gets into unhealthy complex. the actual disorder is only 2% of the population.
